answers.answer: To begin with, erectile function is quite complex, so there are many possibilities that range from the chemical to the anatomical to the neurological (nerves).I cannot explain his erectile function and why it is different than yours. question: Hi....I'm writing coz I need a biological explanation for the way my partner is.  He's a 33 year old man who's overweight, has type 2 diabetes, is a smoker, and leads a sedentary lifestyle.  However, he has no problems whatsoever when it comes to achieving and maintaining erections.  In fact he's like a teenager in that department; he's able to achieve an extremely hard erection simply by thinking about sex or when we're just about to become intimate.  Its like an off/on switch.  The moment we're about to start being intimate he gets an erection, literally....no need for any stimulation. And he's able to maintain an extremely hard erection throughout sex and even after he climaxes....he remains hard (and I mean hard, not semi hard) until we're ready for a second round (or should I say until I'm ready for a second round).  I'm a healthy 32 year old who's not overweight, not a smoker, doesn't have diabetes, and I exercise three times a week.  I know I'm normal/average when it comes to achieving an erection and having a refractory period.  I just need an explanation for how my partner is the way he is.  I understand some people have higher libidos than others, but I don't think he desires sex more than I do (at least this is how I understand the word libido to be).  I need an explanation coz everything I know about science and health suggests he should not be the way he is!  Its making me a little self-conscious!  Thanks.
title: curious about something I think is not normal
